description.zh-cn: 客家人，国民革命军少校，毕业于黄埔军校第六期。淞沪会战中率部坚守宝山县城，最终战死，阵亡后被追授为陆军少将。
description.en: A Hakka Chinese military officer, a major in the National Revolutionary Army, and a graduate of the sixth term of the Whampoa Military Academy. He led his troops in the defense of Baoshan County during the Battle of Shanghai, where he was killed in action and posthumously promoted to Major General.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国大陆时期的一所军事学校。
description.en: A military academy in the Republic of China during the mainland period.

description.zh-cn: 1926年至1928年间，由国民革命军发动的统一中国的战争。
description.en: A military campaign launched by the National Revolutionary Army from 1926 to 1928 to unify China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国国民政府的军事学校，为黄埔军校的后继。
description.en: The military academy of the Nationalist Government of the Republic of China, and the successor to the Whampoa Military Academy.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国陆军一级上将，曾任第十一师师长。
description.en: A first-class general of the Republic of China Army, who once served as the commander of the 11th Division.

description.zh-cn: 国民革命军第十八军下属的一个师。
description.en: A division under the 18th Army of the National Revolutionary Army.

description.zh-cn: 中国抗日战争中第一场重要战役，也是规模最大、战斗最惨烈的一场战役。
description.en: The first major battle of the Second Sino-Japanese War, and one of the largest and bloodiest battles of the war.

description.zh-cn: 淞沪会战中的日方军队所代表的国家实体。
description.en: The state entity represented by the Japanese army in the Battle of Shanghai.

description.zh-cn: 姚子青之弟，在淞沪会战宝山保卫战中一同殉国。
description.en: The younger brother of Yao Ziqing, who was also martyred during the defense of Baoshan in the Battle of Shanghai.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治家及军事家，时任国民政府军事委员会委员长。
description.en: A Chinese politician and military leader, who was the Chairman of the Military Affairs Commission of the Nationalist Government at the time.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国陆军中将，淞沪会战时任第九十八师师长。
description.en: A lieutenant general of the Republic of China Army, who served as the commander of the 98th Division during the Battle of Shanghai.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党、中华人民共和国、中国人民解放军的主要缔造者和领导人。
description.en: The main founder and leader of the Communist Party of China, the People's Republic of China, and the People's Liberation Army.

nodes.id: 中国国民党中央执行委员会

zh-cn: 中国国民党中央执行委员会
en: Central Executive Committee of the Kuomintang

description.zh-cn: 中国国民党于1924年至1950年间的最高权力机关。
description.en: The highest authority of the Kuomintang from 1924 to 1950.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治人物，曾任中国国民党主席，后为荣誉主席。
description.en: A Taiwanese politician, former Chairman of the Kuomintang, and later its Honorary Chairman.

en: Military Affairs Commission of the Nationalist Government

description.zh-cn: 中华民国国民政府时期的最高军事统率机关。
description.en: The supreme military command organ during the Nationalist Government period of the Republic of China.

nodes.id: 中华人民共和国民政部

zh-cn: 中华人民共和国民政部
en: Ministry of Civil Affairs of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国国务院主管民政事务的组成部门。
description.en: A constituent department of the State Council of the People's Republic of China in charge of civil affairs.

nodes.id: 著名抗日英烈和英雄群体名录

zh-cn: 著名抗日英烈和英雄群体名录
en: List of Famous Anti-Japanese Martyrs and Heroic Groups

description.zh-cn: 由中华人民共和国民政部公布的，旨在表彰抗日战争中牺牲的英烈和英雄群体的名单。
description.en: A list published by the Ministry of Civil Affairs of the People's Republic of China to commend the martyrs and heroic groups who sacrificed their lives in the Second Sino-Japanese War.

description.zh-cn: 上海市的市辖区，姚子青在淞沪会战中于此地阵亡。
description.en: A municipal district of Shanghai, where Yao Ziqing was killed in action during the Battle of Shanghai.

description.zh-cn: 中国湖北省武汉市的一部分，历史上曾为独立的汉口市。
description.en: A part of Wuhan, Hubei province, China, historically an independent city.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国广东省梅州市下辖的县，是姚子青的出生地。
description.en: A county under the jurisdiction of Meizhou City, Guangdong Province, People's Republic of China, and the birthplace of Yao Ziqing.

en: 18th Army of the National Revolutionary Army

description.zh-cn: 国民革命军的部队之一，第九十八师的上级单位。
description.en: One of the units of the National Revolutionary Army, the superior unit of the 98th Division.

description.zh-cn: 姚子青出生于广东省嘉应州平远县。
description.en: Yao Ziqing was born in Pingyuan County, Jiaying Prefecture, Guangdong Province.

description.zh-cn: 1926年考入黄埔军校第六期。
description.en: In 1926, he was admitted to the sixth term of the Whampoa Military Academy.

description.zh-cn: 黄埔军校毕业后参加了北伐战争。
description.en: After graduating from the Whampoa Military Academy, he participated in the Northern Expedition.

degree.zh-cn: 高等教育班第一期步兵炮队毕业
degree.en: Graduated from the first term of the higher education class for infantry artillery

description.zh-cn: 北伐战争结束后，转入中央陆军军官学校就读。
description.en: After the Northern Expedition, he transferred to the Central Army Officers Academy to continue his studies.

description.zh-cn: 姚子青曾在陈诚担任师长的第十一师任见习官。
description.en: Yao Ziqing served as a trainee officer in the 11th Division when Chen Cheng was its commander.

position.zh-cn: 第二九二旅第五八三团第三营少校营长
position.en: Major and Commander of the 3rd Battalion, 583rd Regiment, 292nd Brigade

description.zh-cn: 姚子青于1936年3月4日就任第九十八师属下部队的营长，直至1937年9月7日阵亡。
description.en: Yao Ziqing assumed command of a battalion under the 98th Division on March 4, 1936, and held the position until he was killed in action on September 7, 1937.

description.zh-cn: 第九十八师是国民革命军第十八军下辖的部队。
description.en: The 98th Division was a unit under the command of the 18th Army of the National Revolutionary Army.

description.zh-cn: 1937年8月30日，姚子青奉命率部参加淞沪会战，坚守宝山县城，直至9月7日战死。
description.en: On August 30, 1937, Yao Ziqing was ordered to lead his troops to participate in the Battle of Shanghai, defending Baoshan County until he was killed on September 7.

description.zh-cn: 在淞沪会战宝山保卫战中，日军于1937年9月7日攻破宝山城，导致姚子青及全营绝大部分官兵阵亡。
description.en: During the defense of Baoshan in the Battle of Shanghai, Japanese forces breached the city on September 7, 1937, resulting in the death of Yao Ziqing and most of his battalion.

description.zh-cn: 姚志英是姚子青的弟弟。
description.en: Yao Zhiying was Yao Ziqing's younger brother.

description.zh-cn: 姚子青之弟姚志英在宝山保卫战中一同殉国。
description.en: Yao Ziqing's brother, Yao Zhiying, was also martyred during the defense of Baoshan.

description.zh-cn: 姚子青殉国后，蒋介石致电其师长，称赞姚营“全部官兵与城共存亡，实开近世战争之创例”，并要求详报姓名以资表彰。
description.en: After Yao Ziqing's martyrdom, Chiang Kai-shek sent a telegram to his division commander, praising Yao's battalion for 'all officers and soldiers perishing with the city, truly setting a precedent in modern warfare,' and requested their names for commendation.

description.zh-cn: 1938年3月12日，毛泽东在延安的演讲中赞扬姚子青等烈士是全国人民“崇高伟大的模范”。
description.en: On March 12, 1938, in a speech in Yan'an, Mao Zedong praised martyrs like Yao Ziqing as 'lofty and great models' for the entire nation.

relationships.source: 中国国民党中央执行委员会

description.zh-cn: 1937年9月10日，中国国民党中央执行委员会向全国通电，称赞姚子青营“志气之壮，死事之烈，尤足以惊天地而泣鬼神”。
description.en: On September 10, 1937, the Central Executive Committee of the Kuomintang issued a national telegram praising Yao Ziqing's battalion for their 'magnificent spirit and heroic sacrifice, enough to move heaven and earth and make ghosts and gods weep.'

description.zh-cn: 2005年，国民党荣誉主席连战参观上海淞沪抗战纪念馆姚子青营牺牲处时献花，并题词“将军碧血凝青史、壮士英魂映丹心”以作纪念。
description.en: In 2005, KMT Honorary Chairman Lien Chan visited the site of Yao Ziqing's battalion's sacrifice at the Shanghai Songhu Anti-Japanese War Memorial, laid a wreath, and wrote an inscription to commemorate him: 'The general's loyal blood solidifies green history; the hero's valiant soul reflects a loyal heart.'

description.zh-cn: 国民政府军事委员会命令追授姚子青为陆军少将，并在南京为其铸造铜像。
description.en: The Military Affairs Commission of the Nationalist Government ordered the posthumous promotion of Yao Ziqing to Major General and had a bronze statue of him cast in Nanjing.

relationships.source: 中华人民共和国民政部

description.zh-cn: 1983年，中华人民共和国民政部追认姚子青将军为革命烈士。
description.en: In 1983, the Ministry of Civil Affairs of the People's Republic of China posthumously recognized General Yao Ziqing as a revolutionary martyr.

relationships.source: 著名抗日英烈和英雄群体名录

description.zh-cn: 2014年9月1日，姚子青被列入中华人民共和国民政部公布的第一批300名著名抗日英烈和英雄群体名录。
description.en: On September 1, 2014, Yao Ziqing was included in the first batch of 300 famous anti-Japanese martyrs and heroic groups announced by the Ministry of Civil Affairs of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 战后，江苏宝山县曾改名为“子青县”，上海市宝山区的一条路也被更名为“子青路”，以纪念姚子青。
description.en: After the war, Baoshan County in Jiangsu was renamed 'Ziqing County', and a road in Baoshan District, Shanghai was also renamed 'Ziqing Road' to commemorate Yao Ziqing.

description.zh-cn: 汉口市政府将姚子青生前所居住街道改名为“姚子青路”。
description.en: The Hankou municipal government renamed the street where Yao Ziqing had lived to 'Yao Ziqing Road'.

description.zh-cn: 夏楚中在淞沪会战时担任第九十八师师长。
description.en: Xia Chuzhong served as the commander of the 98th Division during the Battle of Shanghai.
